title: National Congress wins Akkaraipattu PS
byline: The National Congress has won the Akkaraipattu Pradeshiya Sabha of the Ampara District.

title: NPP claims Nuwara Eliya MC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Nuwara Eliya Municipal Council of the Nuwara Eliya District.

title: NPP secures Welivitiya Divithura PS
byline: The National People’s Power won the Welivitiya Divithura Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: ITAK wins Verugal PS
byline: The Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi won the Verugal Pradeshiya Sabha of the Trincomalee District.

title: NPP wins Kolonnawa UC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Kolonnawa Urban Council of the Colombo District.

title: NPP wins Morawewa PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Morawewa Pradeshiya Sabha of the Trincomalee District.

title: NPP claims Kadugannawa UC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Kadugannawa Urban Council of the Kandy District.

title: NPP wins Niyagama PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Niyagama Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: NPP wins Soranathota PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Soranathota Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: NPP wins Namaloya PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Namaloya Pradeshiya Sabha of the Ampara District.

title: Public employees involved in LG Election duties granted leave on May 7
byline: The National Election Commission announced that all public employees who were involved in duties related to Local Government Elections including counting of votes, results tabulation, and support services during the LG Polls held on May 6 will be granted duty leave on Wednesday, May 7, 2025.

title: NPP secures Talawakele-Lindula UC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Talawakele-Lindula Urban Council of the Nuwara Eliya District.

title: NPP wins Kalutara MC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Kalutara Municipal Council of the Kalutara District.

title: ITAK secures Puthukkudiyiruppu PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Puthukkudiyiruppu Pradeshiya Sabha of the Mullaitivu District.

title: NPP wins Kegalle MC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Kegalle Municipal Council of the Kegalle District.

title: SLMC wins Irakkamam PS
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress won the Irakkamam Pradeshiya Sabha of the Ampara District.

title: NPP claims Habaraduwa PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Habaraduwa Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: NPP sweeps Hali Ela Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka has released the final results of the Hali Ela Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District in the 2025 Local Government Elections, with the National People’s Power (NPP) polling more than 40% of the total votes.

title: NPP claims Lunugala PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Lunugala Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: ITAK wins Poonakary and Karachchi Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi has secured the Poonakary and Karachchi Pradeshiya Sabhas of the Kilinochchi District.

title: NPP secures Kandaketiya PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Kandaketiya Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: NPP claims Panadura UC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Panadura Urban Council of the Kalutara District.

title: NPP wins Boralesgamuwa UC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Boralesgamuwa Urban Council of the Colombo District.

title: NPP wins Galle MC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Galle Municipal Council of the Galle District.

title: NPP claims Lunugamvehera PS
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Lunugamvehera Pradeshiya Sabha of the Hambantota District.

title: NPP claims Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte MC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte Municipal Council of the Colombo District.

title: NPP wins Kuruwita PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Kuruwita Pradeshiya Sabha of the Ratnapura District.

title: NPP wins Dehiwala Mount Lavinia MC
byline: The National People’s Power has claimed the Dehiwala Mount Lavinia Municipal Council of the Colombo District.

title: NPP secures Maharagama UC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Maharagama Urban Council of the Colombo District.

title: NPP claims Neluwa PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Neluwa Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: NPP claims Ambalangoda PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Ambalangoda Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: NPP wins Ambalantota PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Ambalantota Pradeshiya Sabha of the Hambantota District.

title: NPP wins Uhana and Damana Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Uhana Pradeshiya Sabha and the Damana Pradeshiya Sabha of the Ampara District.

title: NPP wins Chilaw UC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Chilaw Urban Council of the Puttalam District.

title: NPP claims Meegahakivula PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Meegahakivula Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: NPP wins Badulla PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Badulla Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: NPP claims Ella PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Ella Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: NPP wins Eheliyagoda PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Eheliyagoda Pradeshiya Sabha of the Ratnapura District.

title: NPP wins Balapitiya PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: India says it has launched strikes on Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir
byline: Multiple loud explosions were heard in several places in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday as India said it had attacked “terrorist infrastructure” in nine sites and Pakistan vowed to respond to the attacks.

title: NPP wins Bandarawela MC
byline: The National People’s Power has secured the Bandarawela Municipal Council of the Badulla District.

title: NPP secures Rideemaliyadda PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Rideemaliyadda Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: NPP claims Madurawala PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Madurawala Pradeshiya Sabha of the Kalutara District.

title: NPP wins Maskeliya PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Maskeliya Pradeshiya Sabha of the Nuwara Eliya District.

title: NPP secures Thawalama PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Thawalama Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: NPP wins Hatton-Dickoya UC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Hatton-Dickoya Urban Council of the Nuwara Eliya District.

title: NPP wins Thambalagamuwa PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Thambalagamuwa Pradeshiya Sabha of the Trincomalee District.

title: NPP claims Karandeniya PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha of the Galle District.

title: NPP wins Uva Paranagama PS
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Uva Paranagama Pradeshiya Sabha of the Badulla District.

title: ACTC wins Valvettithurai UC
byline: The All Ceylon Tamil Congress has won the Valvettithurai Urban Council of the Jaffna District.

title: NPP wins Yatinuwara, Udapalatha and Pasbage Korale Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The National People’s Power has secured victories in the Yatinuwara, Udapalatha  and Pasbage Korale of the Kandy District.

title: Official election results of LG bodies in Polonnaruwa District
byline: The results of the 2025 Local Government Elections of several LG bodies of the Polonnaruwa district have now been released by the Election Commission.

title: NPP leads in LG Polls, claims overall control in over 100 institutions
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has emerged as the front-runner in the ongoing Local Government Elections, according to results released so far. However, political analysts point out that the ruling party could face challenges in the formation of administrations in a number of LG bodies.

title: NPP secures Naula and Pallepola Pradeshiya Sabhas, SJB tops Laggala-Pallegama PS
byline: The National People’s Power secured victories in the Naula and Pallepola Pradeshiya Sabhas while the Samagi Jana Balawegaya claimed the Laggala-Pallegama Pradeshiya Sabha of the Matale District.

title: NPP secures Kurunegala and Bingiriya Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The National People’s Power secured victories in the Kurunegala and Bingiriya Pradeshiya Sabhas of the Kurunegala District.

title: National Congress claims Akkaraipattu MC
byline: The National Congress has secured the Akkaraipattu Municipal Council of the Ampara District.

title: NPP tops Kurunegala MC
byline: The National People’s Power secured 10 seats in the Kurunegala Municipal Council  after obtaining 5,721 votes.

title: Matale, Kegalle and Minipe Pradeshiya Sabhas won by NPP
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has come on top in the Matale Pradeshiya Sabha in Matale District, the Kegalle Pradeshiya Sabha in Kegalle District and the Minipe Pradeshiya Sabha in Kandy District.

title: SJB secures Akurana UC
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya has secured the Akurana Pradeshiya Sabha of the Kandy District.

title: NPP wins Kandy Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power has secured victory in the Kandy Municipal Council by claiming the majority of seats in one of the major local government institutions in the country.

title: ITAK wins Batticaloa MC
byline: The Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi has secured the Batticaloa Municipal Council of the Batticaloa District.

title: Results of Thalawa, Kytes and Alawwa Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has claimed victory in the Thalawa Pradeshiya Sabha of the Anuradhapura District and the Alawwa Pradeshiya Sabha of the Kurunegala District while the Eelam People’s Democratic Party (EPDP) won in Kytes Pradeshiya Sabha of the Jaffna District.

title: NPP wins Colombo Municipal Council, but fails to secure majority
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has secured victory in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) by winning a total of 48 seats after polling over 81,000 votes (36.92%).

title: NPP takes Dambulla MC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Dambulla Municipal Council after securing 56.77% of the votes.

title: India strikes Pakistan over tourist killings, Pakistan says Indian jets downed
byline: India attacked Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday and Pakistan said it had shot down five Indian fighter jets in the worst fighting in more than two decades between the nuclear-armed enemies.

title: LG Election: Strong mandate for NPP despite losing ground on urban and north-east base
byline: The Sri Lankan public handed another strong mandate to ruling the National People’s Power at the 2025 Local Government (LG) election.

title: SJB ready to lead a united opposition to fulfill people’s demands: Sajith
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa says that the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) is prepared to take the lead in uniting all opposition forces under a shared vision to fulfill the public call to restore a truthful and powerful public service, defeating lies.

title: SJB to seek support of opposition parties to elect Colombo Mayor
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) says it will seek the support of other opposition parties to elect the Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) as the opposition holds a majority in the council.

title: Sri Lanka’s Chief Prelates urge UK govt’s intervention to halt auction of jewels linked to Buddha
byline: The Supreme Patriarchs (Mahanayaka Theros) of Sri Lanka’s Malwatta, Asgiriya, Amarapura and Ramanna Chapters have requested the British government’s intervention in the preservation of archaeological finds linked to Lord Buddha’s corporeal remains found from Uttar Pradesh in India, which are currently at risk of auction.

title: Prasanna Ranaweera remanded after surrendering to court
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera has been remanded until May 19 by the Mahara Magistrate’s Court after surrendering to the court today (May 7).

title: Pakistan authorizes military response after India strikes
byline: India has said it carried out strikes in Pakistan and Pakistani-administered Kashmir. Pakistan has vowed retribution over what it describes as an “act of war.”

title: NPP will not form coalitions with parties rejected by people – Tilvin Silva
byline: Tilvin Silva, General Secretary of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP), the main constituent party in the National People’s Power (NPP) coalition, says the NPP has no intention of establishing majorities in any local government institution through coalitions with parties that have been rejected by the public.

title: Ex-Minister Keheliya arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella has been arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Sotheby’s postpones auction of gems linked to Buddha after India threatens legal action
byline: Auction house Sotheby’s said on Wednesday that it had postponed the auction of a collection of hundreds of jewels linked to Buddha’s corporeal relics after India’s government threatened legal action and demanded the jewels be returned.

title: Election process for next pope commences with papal conclave
byline: The papal conclave, the secretive election process to elect the next leader of the Roman Catholic Church, commences on Wednesday, bringing cardinals from all over the world to select the 267th pope.

title: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella remanded
byline: Former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) earlier today, has been remanded until May 20 by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Pakistan vows retaliation after India’s ‘Operation Sindoor’ strikes kill 26
byline: India hit Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir with missiles on Wednesday and Pakistan said it had shot down five Indian aircraft and vowed to retaliate, in the worst fighting in more than two decades between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: President meets World Bank chief, discuss 3-year partnership
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with World Bank President Ajay Banga, who is on an official visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Sumitra Peries’ ‘Gehenu Lamai’ restored 4K version to premiere at Cannes Festival 2025
byline: ‘Gehenu Lamai’, directed by the late Dr. Sumitra Peries, will be screened next week in the Official Selection of the Cannes Film Festival, which will be held from May 13 to May 24 in Cannes, France, under the Cannes Classics category.

title: Sumitra Peries’ ‘Gehenu Lamai’ restored 4K version to premiere at Cannes Festival 2025
byline: ‘Gehenu Lamai’, directed by the late Dr. Sumitra Peries, will be screened next week in the Official Selection of the Cannes Film Festival, which will be held from May 13 to May 24 in Cannes, France, under the Cannes Classics category.

title: World Bank to boost jobs and private sector growth in Sri Lanka with $1 billion support package
byline: The World Bank Group today announced a major initiative to support job creation and unlock private sector growth in Sri Lanka, backed by more than $1 billion in financing over three years.
